metadata.title: CVE-2021-47294 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: netrom:Decrease sock refcount when sock timers expire Commit 63346650c1a9("netrom: switch to sock timer API") switched to use sock timer API. Itreplaces mod_timer() by sk_reset_timer(), and del_timer() bysk_stop_timer(). Function sk_reset_timer() will increase the refcount ofsock if it is called on an inactive timer, hence, in case the timerexpires, we need to decrease the refcount ourselves in the handler,otherwise, the sock refcount will be unbalanced and the sock will never befreed.
